titles: The languishing lover cured, and the coy lady by cupid converted. In a passionate discourse of love, between Florio, Cupid, and Philida. To the tune of, Hang sorrow cast away care.
publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright,
notes: Verse: "VVhat a sorry life I live ..."
Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
